input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Proliferative diabetic retinopathy

YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE A 62-YEAR-OLD AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS MALE
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Blurry vision
- Shadows in your vision
- Temporary episodes of vision loss
- Some difficulty seeing clearly in low light
- Occasionally noticing new dark spots in your field of view
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION gradually over the past two months. I’ve had diabetes for about 15 years, and I know my blood sugar hasn’t been well-controlled lately. My blood pressure and cholesterol levels are also high, which I think might be making things worse. I’ve noticed my vision getting worse, especially when I try to read or drive at night, and sometimes I see shadows or dark areas that come and go. It’s been pretty frustrating, and I’m worried it might get worse or lead to permanent loss.
